page.title: 04Our Visit to the Archives.
page.content: On{Monday, 13th May}we went on a visit to the County Archive. Our guide was Mrs. Burt. She showed us many{old {slides}and old books from which we got a picture of Seaton Delaval as it was. One slide in particular was very interesting. It showed some boys playing at the beach at Seaton Sluice and wearing their best clothes. We wondered what our mothers would say if we did that today! The{colliery}in Seaton Delaval was first owned by the Seaton Delaval Coal Co. Ltd. and employed 970 men and boys. The Coal Co. erected the Mechanics Institute with reading rooms, billiard room and smoke rooms at a cost of Â£1 000. Today this building stands near our school, derelict.
